TopicTitle: Take a sentence and turn it.

Articles.Content:
in this game, we take a sentence, then mash it through at least 3 layers of Google Translate.

 

ex: Me: (translated) 83 beer bottles on the wall
83 bottles of beer!
Handing down
There are 82 beer bottles on the wall! (then we say the original sentence.) 83 bottles of beer on the wall, etc. Hope that made sense. The goal of this stupid game is to see what kind of stupid stuff Google Translate does when directly translating words.

I actually don't know how many times I translated this sentence, probably at least 40 times

translated: I don't know what it is, but I read "What Google Translator saw in the live translation" and translated it into KYRGYZ 10 times.

original: I have no idea what this is, but I read "to see what stupid things Google Translate does when it translates words directly", so yeah, I am going to translate this into KYRGYZ 10 times or so.

Original:  Something tells me that you got this idea from one of my posts.

Translated:  Garrison Neshta football idejata doara pleasure oil.

Russian and Latin don't mix very well.  Can't remember what the other language was.

original: I am apparently incapable of correctly understanding the rules of these threads. don't worry tho, I did it correctly this time, maybe.

translated: This is different from the study of cultural principles. Do not worry

all google translate did was simplify my sentence. 

boring

cultural principles

 

original : once a sentence just runs away like this, you know that Google is not happy.

”translated”: I know how to avoid google and shamelessly.

 

languages (in no particular order): French, Traditional Chinese x2 (yes, it actually came up differently), German, Latin, and Polish (not the nails)
